c74object.name: bach.slice
c74object.description: Splits lllls in two, according to a split point.

outlet.digest: The left part of the splitted llll
The right part of the splitted llll

objarg.name: index
objarg.description: The split point, that is the position of the first element of the second part of the llll. If a negative position is set, it is counted from the end of the llll. The split point can only be in the root level of the llll.

method.name: bang
method.description: The most recently received llll is split.

method.name: llll
method.description: The llll is divided in two, at the split point set by the index attribute, and the two parts are output from the two outlets.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: The split point, that is the position of the last element of the first part of the llll. If a negative position is set, it is counted from the end of the llll. The split point can only be in the root level of the llll. The default is 1.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The left part of the splitted llll.

entry.name: Outlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: The right part of the splitted llll.
